lines.content: * Fork this repo to your GitHub account and clone the fork to your computer
1. Open IntelliJ (if you are not in the welcome screen, click `File` > `Close Project` to close the existing project dialog first).
1. Set up the correct JDK version.
* Click `Configure` > `Structure for new Projects` (in older versions of Intellij:`Configure` > `Project Defaults` > `Project Structure`).
* If JDK 11 is listed in the drop down, select it. If it is not, click `New...` and select the directory where you installed JDK 11.
1. Locate the project directory and click `OK`.
1. Select `Create project from existing sources` and click `Next`.
1. Rename the project if you want. Click `Next`.
1. Ensure that your src folder is checked. Keep clicking `Next`.

`Level-10` | JavaFX tutorials:
→ [Part 1: Introduction to JavaFX][fx1]
→ [Part 2: Creating a GUifor Duke][fx2]
→ [Part 3: Interacting with the user][fx3]
→ [Part 4: Introduction to FXML][fx4]
* If you have feedback or bug reports, please post in [se-edu/duke issue tracker](https://github.com/se-edu/duke/issues).
// Change this to your main class.
* The Duke Program contains main method.
* The AddCommand program call method to add task into the taskList.
* @param taskList refers a taskList object that manages the current list of tasks.
* Calls method to add task into taskList.
* @param taskDescriptionArr is a parsed task description which
* The Command program calls the method relevant to the command.
* @param taskList refers a taskList object that manages the current list of tasks.
* Calls method relevant to the command.
* @param taskDescriptionArr is a parsed task description which
* The DeleteCommand program calls method to delete task from taskList and storage.
* @param taskList refers a taskList object that manages the current list of tasks.
* Calls method to delete the task from taskList.
* @param taskDescriptionArr is a parsed task description which
* The DoneCommand program calls method to mark task as done.
* @param taskList refers a taskList object that manages the current list of tasks.
* Calls method to mark the task as done.
* @param taskDescriptionArr is a parsed task description which
* The ExitCommand program prints the exit message.
* @param taskList refers a taskList object that manages the current list of tasks.
System.out.println("Bye. I hope you liked the service and hope to see you soon !");
* The FindCommand calls method to find tasks with relevant keyword.
* @param taskList refers a taskList object that manages the current list of tasks.
* Calls method to find tasks with keyword.
* @param taskDescriptionArr is a parsed task description which
* The ListCommand calls method to list task in taskList.
* @param taskList refers a taskList object that manages the current list of tasks.
* Calls method to list tasks in taskList.
* @param taskDescriptionArr is a parsed task description which
* The EmptyDateError program is an error thrown when user input is missing required date.
* Constructs error message with respect the error.
return "\nOPPS! The date of a " + super.getType() + " cannot be empty.";
* The EmptyDescriptionError program is an error thrown when user input is missing required description.
* Constructs error message with respect the error.
return "\nOPPS! The description of a " + super.getType() + " cannot be empty";
* The Exception program is an error thrown when there is a user input error.
* @param type refers to the type of Task.
* Constructs error message with respect the error.
* Gets the type of task with error.
* The InvalidDateError program is an error thrown when user inputs an invalid date format.
* Constructs error message with respect the error.
return "Date should be in d/MM/yyyy HH:mm format";
return "Date should be in d/MM/yyyy HH:mm to /MM/yyyy HH:mm format";
* The InvalidInputError program is an error thrown when user inputs an invalid input.
* Constructs error message with respect the error.
return "OOPS! I'm sorry, but I don't know what that means.";
* The MissingKeyword program is an error thrown when user input is missing required keyword.
* Constructs error message with respect the error.
return "\nOOPS! I'm sorry, the keyword is missing.";
* The MissingTaskNumber program is an error thrown when user input is missing required task number.
* Constructs error message with respect the error.
return "\nOOPS! I'm sorry, the task number is missing.";
* The Parser program passes user input, date and time related to a task.
* @param input refers to the user input.
* @return string array consisting of the parsed input.
* @throws Exception is an error thrown when input is incorrect.
public String[] parseUserInput(String input) throws Exception {
* Parses date and time of the task. If task do not have date, a dummy date
* @param dateTime the date and time of the task.
* @return parsed date and time in form of LocalDateTime object.
* @throws InvalidDateError is an error thrown when date has incorrect format.
public LocalDateTime[] parseDateTime(String dateTime, String type) throws InvalidDateError {
* The Storage program loads and updates the file. It interprets the content of
* file in order to do so. It also contains TaskList.
* @param path refers to the path of file.
* @param taskList refers to the TaskList object that will manage taskList.
* Interprets content of file and calls method to add it into taskList.
* Updates file with respect to the operations performed to taskList.
* @param operation refers to the updates on taskList.
* @throws IOException when file writer encounters error.
public void updateFile(String operation) throws IOException {
* Generates the input to file for each Task.
* @param task is needed to generate its relevant input into the file.
return type + "//" + status + "//" + taskDescription + "//" + dateTime[0] + "//" + dateTime[1] + "\n";
* The Deadline program is a type of task with specified deadline. It has a string representation
* and is able to return the type of task it is.
* @param dateTime refers to the date and time of the task.
* @param taskDescription refers to the contents of the task.
* Constructs a string representation of task.
* Gets the type of the task.
* The Event program is a type of Task with specified start and end date. It has a string representation
* and is able to return the type of task it is.
* @param dateTime refers to the date and time of the task.
* @param taskDescription refers to the contents of the task.
* Constructs a string representation of task.
* Gets the type of the task.
* The Task program is a general task class that other tasks inherits from.
* @param dateTime refers to the date and time of the task.
* @param taskDescription refers to the contents of the task.
* Updates the status of the task.
* @param newStatus is the new status of the task.
* Gets date and time related to the task.
* Gets task description of the task.
* Gets the type of the task.
* Constructs a string representation of task.
* The ToDo program is a task with task description only. It has a string representation
* and is able to return the type of task it is.
* @param dateTime refers to the date and time of the task.
* @param taskDescription refers to the contents of the task.
* Constructs a string representation of task.
* Gets the type of the task.
* The TaskList program manages the taskList. It is able to add, delete, list and mark tasks in
* taskList as done. It also contains Storage.
* @param storage refers to storage object required for file storage.
* Prints all the tasks in taskList.
String start = "\nHere are the tasks in your list:";
* Adds task into taskList and calls method to update file storage.

* @return Task added to taskList and Storage.
* @throws IOException as a result of updateFile throwing exception.
public Task addTask(String taskDescription, LocalDateTime[] dateTime,

* @param status refers to the status of the task.
public Task addTask(String taskDescription, LocalDateTime dateTimeStart,
LocalDateTime dateTimeEnd, Task.Types type, Task.Status status)  {

* Prints out total number of tasks in taskList.
* @return total number of tasks in taskList.
return "Now you have " + taskList.size() + " tasks in the list";
* Gets tasks from taskList specified at index.
* @param index refers to the position of task in taskList.
